info.description:
## What is APInf?

APinf is open source API management and catalog. Solution supports both REST and MQTT proxies. You can have multiple proxies under one management.

----


** Check out free to use community instance at https://apinf.io ** 

----


### For API owners 

APInf provides you with a unified, simple interface for publishing your APIs to the developer community and performing complex API management tasks. It allows you to gain a better understanding of your API trafÔ¨Åc. 

 Each organization has organization page which provides single URL to promote to developers. 

### For developers (API end-user) 
For developers APInf catalog and dashboard offers a one stop location to discover APIs, track your application API usage, and more.

### APInf User API
With this API you can Add, Update and Remove (CRUD) information about APInf service users.

### Examples for each method to get you started

In documentation each of the methods contain simple examples to get you started. Here's an example.

Example call: ``` GET /apis?limit=200&lifecycle=production``` 
    
Result: returns maximum of 200 APIs which are in production lifecycle. More examples can be found from each method. 

### API keys, authentication and dates 

* We require API key in all GET methods. You can get it by creating account to Apinf system. Create it now from https://apinf.io/sign-up 
* All POST, PUT and DELETE methods require valid authentication. 
* Dates and times are returned in ISODate format, for example "2012-07-14T01:00:00+01:00". 

----
info.title: APInf User API

externalDocs.description: Find out more about our store

get.description:
By passing in the appropriate options, you can search for users in the system. At the moment user can only belong to one organization. (We have plans to support multiorganization model.) By default, method returns 100 users sorted by username. You can adjust the amount of returned list with ```limit``` paramater. ----
** A Simple example **
List maximum of 50 users, sort by username
``` GET /users?limit=50&sort_by=username```
-----

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Pass an optional search string for looking up users.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: Pass an optional organization id. Parameter will limit results to the given organization.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: number of records to skip for pagination.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: For sorting you can use following options "username, created_at, updated_at, organization (organization name)". You can provide multiple options to apply multilevel sorting. First given option is applied first.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return in query.

post.description: Adds a user to the system.

parameters.name: api
parameters.description: User to add. Field ```id``` will be generated by the system, thus any given value will be overridden.

put.description: Updates a user in the system.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the user to update.

parameters.name: api
parameters.description: User to update. Field ```id``` is not used.

delete.description: Deletes the identified user from the system.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the user to delete.

get.description:
By passing in the appropriate options, you can get a list of updated users in the system. At the moment user can  belong only to one organization. We have plans to support multiorganization model. Dates and times are returned in ISODate format, for example "2012-07-14T01:00:00+01:00". 

By default methods returns maximum of 100 items. Also by default applied timeframe is past 7 days (see parameter ```since```).

----

** A Simple example **

List maximum of 50 updated users 

``` GET /users/updates?limit=50```

----
** Get only new users created during past week **

``` GET /users/updates?since=7d&new_users_only=true```

----

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Pass an optional delimiter as days - result will contain changes in users during given time frame. Options are "1d, 7d, 30d".

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Pass an optional id of the organization.  Result is either one or zero (no match found) users. *When this  parameter is used, other parameters are obsolete*.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return in query.

parameters.name: new_users_only
parameters.description: If this is set to 'true', only new users are returned and users with updated information are excluded.

created_at.description: Dates and times are stored in ISODate format, for example "2012-07-14T01:00:00+01:00".

updated_at.description: Dates and times are stored in ISODate format, for example "2012-07-14T01:00:00+01:00".

organization.description: API can only belong to one organization.

created_at.description: Dates and times are stored in ISODate format, for example "2012-07-14T01:00:00+01:00".

updated_at.description: Dates and times are stored in ISODate format, for example "2012-07-14T01:00:00+01:00".

created_at.description: Dates and times are stored in ISODate format, for example "2012-07-14T01:00:00+01:00".

updated_at.description: Dates and times are stored in ISODate format, for example "2012-07-14T01:00:00+01:00".
